name: African Milk Tree
description: Euphorbia trigona, commonly known as African Milk Tree, is a succulent native to tropical regions of Central and West Africa, particularly Angola and Namibia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and features upright, columnar stems (100-300 cm tall) with large, dramatic, triangular, dark green stems with distinctive ridges and small leaves. The plant displays an upright, columnar growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows in dry, sunny areas. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds architectural interest with its distinctive columnar shape. It's popular among succulent enthusiasts for its unique appearance. Note: produces toxic milky sap.
careTips: Let soil dry completely between waterings
Bright light preferred - can tolerate direct sun
Avoid overwatering - prone to root rot
Handle with care - toxic milky sap
